Object.Field:
Author: Oracle Version: 10.1.3 Last Update : July 2007 SK: Added UseFriendlyNames option. Last Update : Oct 2007 BT: Remove the DDL.xsd reference before processing the DDX files.
Description : - Reverse engineering Knowledge Module to retrieve file definitions from Oracle Data Quality DDX description files - This KM provides logging (Use Log & Log File Name) options.
To use this knowledge module and run the reverse engineering: 1. Import this knowledge module in one of your projects. 2. Create a file model, and choose the reverse context as well as the knowledge module in the "reverse" tab. 3. Execute the reverse engineering and follow up the steps in the logs
Restrictions: - The tab Selective reverse cannot be used with this knowledge module.
**** NOTICE **** 1. Redefined fields are also reversed. 2. File structure is reverse engineered as FIXED file. 3. Keep the original structure of project directory: =>Projectn =>data =>ddl =>logs =>scripts =>setting =>tables =>tmp
DDX Files to reverse-engineer. Use wildcards to process several files.
File Format of the datastore (D=Delimited: F= Fixed)
Record separator or several characters separating lines or records in the file: (MS-DOS, UNIX or null)
One or several characters separating the fields in a record
Set this option to Yes if you want the Reverse-Engineering process to create friendly names for field names for your DDX files
Set to Yes if you want the reverse-engineering process log details in a log file.

IMod = <%=snpRef.getModel("ID")%>
logfile = r'<%=odiRef.getOption("LOG_FILE_NAME")%>' uselog = <%=odiRef.getOption("USE_LOG")%> Logger = Log(logfilename=logfile, uselog=uselog, printtoscreen=0) DDXDir = r'<%=odiRef.getInfo( "SRC_SCHEMA" )%>' DDXPattern= '<%=odiRef.getOption("DDX_FILE_NAME")%>' usefriendlynames = <%=odiRef.getOption("USE_FRIENDLY_NAMES")%> fileFormat = '<%=odiRef.getOption("FILE_FORMAT")%>'
rS = '<%=odiRef.getOption("RECORD_SEPARATOR")%>' if rS=='MS-DOS': recordSeparator = '0D0A' elif rS == 'UNIX': recordSeparator = '0A' else: recordSeparator = ''
fieldSeparator = '<%=odiRef.getOption("FIELD_SEPARATOR")%>'
Cx = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("DEST")
rev = DDXReverse(IMod, DDXDir, DDXPattern, Cx, Logger, usefriendlynames,fileFormat,recordSeparator,fieldSeparator) rev.startReverse()
